<title level="1" right="Rules">[Longer Periods of Downtime](/Rules.aspx?ID=2613)</title>

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 46 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
Running downtime during a long time off—like several weeks, months, or even years—can be more challenging. However, it’s also an opportunity for the characters to progress toward long-term plans rather than worrying about day-to-day activities. Because so much time is involved, characters don’t roll a check for each day. Instead, they deal with a few special events, average out the rest of the downtime, and expend any resources, such as their general cost of living.
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
